alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia; East Carroll; Franklin; Madison; Richland; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 1:43PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: 143 PM CDT Thu Oct 19 2023 ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS EXPECTED FRIDAY, OCTOBER 20 AND SATURDAY, OCTOBER 21... According to local forestry agencies and the U.S. Forest Service, recent long-term drought conditions are making any outdoor burning increasingly hazardous. Conditions are such that a spark from equipment, the heat from a catalytic converter, or any heat source could start a grass or brush fire. The combination of extreme to exceptionally dry fine fuels, such as grass, low relative humidity and gusty surface winds will result in elevated wildfire danger across the region the next couple of days. Fire danger is highest in areas that have not received substantial rainfall over the past few months. Minimum relative humidity values will range from 20-30% and gusty surface winds greater than 10mph, especially Friday, will create high fire danger given the long-term drought conditions. Numerous Mississippi counties and Louisiana parishes remain under local burn bans at the present time. Fires place local forestry agencies, fire departments, and other fire control agencies in life threatening situations, and can endanger communities. Please use caution and help prevent forest and grass fires.
